H0.text: Skeletal is the body system that heart disease most directly affects, causing a reduced amount of oxygen to move properly through the body.

H1.text: The excretory system is the body system that heart disease most directly affects, which can result in a reduced amount of oxygen moving properly through the body.

H2.text: Circulatory is the body system most directly affected by heart disease, which can result in a reduced amount of oxygen moving properly through the body.

H3.text: The nervous system is the body system that heart disease most directly affects, as heart disease can result in a reduced amount of oxygen moving properly through the body.

A4.text: The circulatory system includes the heart, blood vessels, and blood.

A5.text: Cardiovascular disease may also be congenital in nature, such as heart defects or persistent fetal circulation, where the circulatory changes that are supposed to happen after birth do not.
